Articles.Content:
First post, just wanted to say 'hi'. I've lurked for a bit and have seen some fantastic ships, challenges, etc. Figured I'd jump in the shallow end and paddle around, see what I could learn from everyone and hopefully share anything useful I figure out. Thanks for having me!

Shamus

Welcome, Shamus6200! Glad you decided to join.

Learning and teaching are some of the best parts of this forum, largely due to a truly excellent community.

Happy landings!

Welcome among us then ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Make sure to share if you create something worth sharing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Welcome!

I'm sure you'll lose the water wings in no time!

Thank you for the welcome! Currently working on a Dres and return mission, which should be interesting as I've never even sent a probe there before ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif). Going with a standard lander and launch vehicle setup and a nuclear command module for the trip out there and back. I'm using FAR, Deadly Reentry, Remote Tech and a few other mods at the moment, working my way up to the Realism Overhaul at some point I think. 

BTW, my son just recently got involved with a great BSA troop Dman979, he really enjoys it so far. Good organization.
Welcome to the KSP Kommunity! (Get it?)

Oh, wonderful!

If he has any questions about anything Scouting related, I'd be happy to help. Or there's the other alternative, which is "ask your SPL" ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Welcome to forums!

..Also reminds me, I have yet to do my Dres manned mission....

Alas, Jeb didn't make it back from the Dres mission. No matter how I planned it, I couldn't get the return burn to be within the limits of his life support supplies (TAC mod) and he died of oxygen deprivation, just 32 days shy of the encounter with Kerbin and home. Such is the life of a hero Kerbanaut and he will forever be remembered as the father of our space program and an inspiration for others to follow.

> 
> Alas, Jeb didn't make it back from the Dres mission. No matter how I planned it, I couldn't get the return burn to be within the limits of his life support supplies (TAC mod) and he died of oxygen deprivation, just 32 days shy of the encounter with Kerbin and home. Such is the life of a hero Kerbanaut and he will forever be remembered as the father of our space program and an inspiration for others to follow.

Oh no!

Well, sadly, we learn from our mistakes.

Unless you're a Kerbal.

Welcome aboard, have fun here, and enjoy the best gaming community in existence.

DMSP
